pullrequest.title: WIP: Eigenvalue solver; antidifferentiate methods; mid-domain BC

content.raw: As a quick note, I'm still seeing 10% cost for doing RHS dz derivatives in fully scaled out 2-D convection runs (arising from nonlinear advection of density).   At this level, the RHS dz cost is within a factor of 2 of the sparse solve. So definitely worth moving dz to implicit side at this point whenever possible. I expect that adding an additional eqn (eg, rho_z -dz(rho) = 0) will cost less in general than doing a RHS dz. I'll test this and get back to everyone.
